_header: By west under a wild wood side / In a land…
_description: Mercy Passes all Things — sixteen 12-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Mercy passeth alle thinge’

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
BI west vnder a wylde wode sydeIn a launde þer I was
                    lente…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Bi fore þi face þat we mai saiNow Merci passeþ
                    alle þinge

Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
BI west vnder a wilde wode sydeIn a launde þer I was
                    lent…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Byfore þi face þat we may sayNow Merci passeþ
                    alle þing

Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).

BLAdd31042.First Lines: BE weste vndir a wilde wodde sydeAppon a launde there als I laye was lent…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …By fore thi [      ]That Mercy passes alle thynge
BLAdd31042.Note: In second line “laye” after “I” crossed through and replaced by “was lent”; last stanza squeezed at bottom of leaf two lines of verse per line of manuscript, the last few lines badly rubbed and partly illegible; ends “Explicit Cantus Amen.”
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: A Songe how þat Mercy passeth alle thynge (f. 123vb)
BLAdd31042.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             “Handschrift British Museum Additional 31042.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         132 (1914): 316-27: 323-7.
